questionblock.text: Since I took my opioid pain medication, my physical pain has decreased.
Since I took my opioid pain medication, I feel happier.
Since I took my opioid pain medication, it has been harder to think or perform a task.
Since I took my opioid pain medication, my unpleasant feelings have been relieved.
Since I took my opioid pain medication, I have had pleasant feelings.
Since I took my opioid pain medication, I feel more relaxed or calm.
Since I took my opioid pain medication, I feel worse.
Since I took my opioid pain medication, I have been able to get through my work or activities.
Since I took my opioid pain medication, I forgot about my problems.
Since I took my opioid pain medication, I feel less depressed.

question.text: Which OPIOID PAIN MEDICATION did you take?
question.answer: Secondary (the medication you take as needed)

question.text: How much of your OPIOID PAIN MEDICATION did you take SINCE the last survey you answered?

question.answer: This is when I normally take my pain medication.
My pain increased or I had breakthrough pain.
I forgot to take my pain medication until now.
I am taking my pain medication early.
The pain medication I took earlier did not sufficiently reduce my pain.
I wanted to take my pain medication for other reasons.

question.text: In addition to your OPIOID PAIN MEDICATION, have you taken any other PAIN medications since the last survey you answered?
What OTHER pain medication did you take?
